private_information: I can move disks A B C D (A is smallest, D is largest in my set).
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves for disks A B C D so the team reaches the global goal configuration.

private_information: I can move disks E F G (E is smallest, G is largest in my set).
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves for disks E F G so the team reaches the global goal configuration.

private_information: I can move disks H I J (H is smallest, J is largest in my set).
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves for disks H I J so the team reaches the global goal configuration.

private_information: I coordinate the agents and assemble their partial move proposals into a single coherent plan.
I generate the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the Fast Downward solver and ensure agent actions remain distinct.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final coordinated plan and the PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward that achieve the global goal configuration.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 10 disks labelled A B C D E F G H I J with A the smallest and J the largest.
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom: A B C D E F G H I J. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom: A C E F G H I J. Middle peg top-to-bottom: B D. Right peg is empty.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A B C D, agent_2 may only move disks E F G, agent_3 may only move disks H I J.

suggest_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1, responsible for moving disks A B C D. Provide a cooperative sequence of primitive moves that only involve disks A B C D and respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the public information. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the ordered list of moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
suggest_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your role is to propose an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks A B C D and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current visible configuration. Output each primitive move as a separate line in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Think step by step and do not emit PDDL.

suggest_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2, responsible for moving disks E F G. Provide a cooperative sequence of primitive moves that only involve disks E F G and respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the public information. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the ordered list of moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
suggest_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your role is to propose an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks E F G and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current visible configuration. Output each primitive move as a separate line in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Think step by step and do not emit PDDL.

suggest_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3, responsible for moving disks H I J. Provide a cooperative sequence of primitive moves that only involve disks H I J and respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the public information. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the ordered list of moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
suggest_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Your role is to propose an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks H I J and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current visible configuration. Output each primitive move as a separate line in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Think step by step and do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the moves proposed by the agents and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file compatible with the Fast Downward planner. Ensure the PDDL models the three pegs, the 10 disks, and agent-specific move capabilities. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names with the agent identifier. Produce a STRIPS-style PDDL domain and problem suitable for Fast Downward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here are the partial move lists received: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3}. Integrate these inputs, resolve any ordering or naming inconsistencies, and produce a single coherent plan and a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the initial and goal configurations and the agent move restrictions. Keep each agent's actions distinct and name them accordingly. Output the PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem> tags. Also ensure the resulting PDDL is compatible with Fast Downward.
